section.name: Commons Text
section.p: Apache Commons Text is a library focused on algorithms working on strins.

section.name: Documentation
section.p: The package descriptions in the JavaDoc give an overview of the available features and various project reports are provided.
The subversion repository can be browsed, or you can browse/contribute via GitHub.
The code base is monitored by a Sonar instance running on analysis.apache.org.

section.name: Release Information
section.p: There have not been any official releases yet.

section.name: Getting Involved
section.p: The commons developer mailing list is the main channel of communication for contributors. Please remember that the lists are shared between all commons components, so prefix your email by [lang].
You can also visit the #apache-commons IRC channel on irc.freenode.net or peruse JIRA. Specific links of interest for JIRA are:

ul.li: Ideas looking for code: Patch Needed
Issues with patches, looking for reviews: Review Patch

section.p: Alternatively you can go through the Needs Work tags in the TagList report.
If you'd like to offer up pull requests via GitHub rather than applying patches to JIRA, we have a GitHub mirror.

section.name: Support
section.p: The commons mailing lists act as the main support forum. The user list is suitable for most library usage queries. The dev list is intended for the development discussion. Please remember that the lists are shared between all commons components, so prefix your email by [lang].
Bug reports and enhancements are also welcomed via the JIRA issue tracker. Please read the instructions carefully.
